item.title: Death Stranding 2: How to Watch a Live Performance in Your Private Room
item.description:
If players are looking to get A Private Show trophy in Death Stranding 2 or simply want to see Dollman dance, then they've come to the right place. Hideo Kojima loves an easter egg, especially zany ones for all players to enjoy. Luckily, this one isn't hard to achieve, and all players will be able to do it with ease.

Players can watch a private show in Death Stranding 2 from Dollman in their private room, provided that they know how to trigger it, so for players who are searching for this trophy for the platinum, then this is exactly what they need to do.

How to Watch A Private Performance in Death Stranding 2

How to Get A Private Show Trophy

In order to get A Private Show trophy in Death Stranding 2 , players must first have the Music Player. The Music Player is given to the player once they reach Australia and meet the Musician in Order No. 11 and connect him to the Chiral Network. With the Musician connected to the Chiral Network, he will immediately gift players with a Music Player and the Horizon Dreamer track from Daichi Miura , which are the two items players will need for this achievement.

Once players have received both of these rewards, head back to Sam's private room on board the DHV Magellan and hit the Options button to scroll down to the Music Player, and then click Horizon Dreamer and then click the Square button to play the song. With this song now playing, look to Dollman, who is resting on the left by the exit door, and speak with him. Players can activate a live performance in their private room by speaking to Dollman while Horizon Dreamer is playing and when prompted, respond to Dollman with "Just a quick one." This triggers a live performance where Dollman dances along to the entirety of Horizon Dreamer, which is a near-4-minute performance . Players can either watch the entire performance or back out with the Circle button, as both will provide them with the A Private Show trophy, even if they have not watched the full show.

item.title: Death Stranding 2: How to Barter with Another Porter
item.description:
Porters are incredibly important to the world of Death Stranding 2 . Forming connections from the safety of one's bunker as a prepper isolated from the world is what helps keep the Chiral Network afloat, and the Porters that roam Australia to deliver cargo are the true heroes. Porters can be found across Australia, and Sam can interact with them by providing them with likes, waves, and snarky comments, but he can also trade with them.

Trading with other Porters is a great way to get some nice gear, but it's also an opportunity to get a rather easy trophy in Death Stranding 2 , thanks to the Porters Make the World Go Round trophy, so players can find out exactly how to get it, below.

How to Barter With Another Porter in Death Stranding 2

How to Get the Porters Make the World Go Round Trophy

Players can find NPC Porters that will roam across Australia and Mexico after they complete Order No. 12. While Porters are random, players can find them rather easily heading towards, or close by, major cities and settlements, like West Fort Knot, and across the pathways that are connected by roads and monorails. To easily search for Porters, players should tap L1 to scan the area and locate moving cargo, as Porters will always move in groups of two, which makes them easier to discover since the scanner will locate their cargo.

Once players find a Porter, they can initiate a barter by approaching them. The Porter will release an item they are carrying and hold it out to offer it to Sam, and Sam will want to pick it up , regardless of what it is. Once Sam has taken the Porter's item, players will need to trade one of their own. This can be achieved simply by entering Cargo Management by clicking the Options button, and then dropping a random item , like a Blood Grenade or Container Repair Spray, in front of the Porter. The Porter will pick up the item to conclude the trade, which will then trigger the Porters Make the World Go Round trophy to pop.

item.title: Death Stranding 2: How to Find an Albino Animal
item.description:
Capturing animals is a great way to get likes from the Animal Sanctuary, and a nice way to know that Sam is preserving wildlife by keeping them safe in a habitat for Death Stranding 2 . With so many animals in Australia, it's no surprise that Sam can find some rarities, like the albino variants that can be rescued for a neat trophy and a cute display at the Animal Sanctuary.

Regardless of whether players are trying to get the Death Stranding 2 platinum trophy by first completing the Rare Specimen Rescuer trophy, or they simply want to see a rare and cute animal for themselves, the location of albino animals in Death Stranding 2 can be found below so that players can do both.

Where to Find and Deliver Albino Animals in Death Stranding 2

How to Get the Rare Specimen Rescuer Trophy

Animals will begin to spawn within Australia once players complete Order No. 15. With animals now becoming frequent across Australia, they will have to wait a little longer to get albino animals to spawn, as they have set conditions that are unlocked later in the game once players have connected the Pioneer to the Chiral Network. Players can find the Pioneer after Order No. 28 , and players will need to find some of his lost cargo around The Motherhood and deliver it for him to want to join the Chiral Network. Once connected, players can check the Aid Requests, where the Pioneer will occasionally add the location of a wild albino animal .

While players have a selection between the kangaroo, lyrebird, and echidna, the albino kangaroo is by far the easiest to find and spawns before connecting to the Pioneer . Players can find the albino kangaroo in the desert just north of Heartman's Lab and the Data Scientist , and they should be able to spot the albino kangaroo roaming. It's hard to miss, as it has a stunning white coat on a large animal amidst a dry and red desert. Once players have located the animal, knock it out with rubber bullets or simply chase it down and then package it up, and deliver it back to the Animal Shelter . Since the Animal Shelter is pretty far away, try and build roads and bring a vehicle so that the journey is a tad easier. Upon delivering the albino animal, the Rare Specimen Rescuer trophy will pop.

item.title: Hades 2's Secret Mortal Kombat Tribute Explained
item.description:
This article contains MAJOR SPOILERS for Hades 2 's boss fights.

There are a handful of video game franchises that have been around for so long and that have been so influential that they've transcended the medium. Mortal Kombat is one such franchise, having become a household name overnight when it originally hit arcade floors in 1992, and it having a wealth of multimedia adaptations and spinoffs in the 33 years since. But alongside their own projects, hugely influential franchises like Mortal Kombat are often referenced throughout the medium they mostly belong to, and Hades 2 is the most recent example of that.

Mortal Kombat references have popped up in countless games over the years in various forms, ranging from alternate costumes in League of Legends to a collectible figure of Scorpion in Cyberpunk 2077 to a dozen different games using the line "Finish Him." But Hades 2 's Mortal Kombat tribute is unlike most that have come before it in that it's totally hidden from the average player.

Hades 2 Features An 'Unseen' Mortal Kombat Easter Egg

Hades 2's Mortal Kombat Tribute is Linked With Its Final Boss Fight

Hades 2 's latest Unseen update adds a new gameplay system called "Vow of Rivals." Available after defeating all of the game's bosses at least once (and completing a checklist of side activities), Hades 2 's Vow of Rivals sees players work through the entire game again, this time facing off against dramatically harder boss fights. These higher-difficulty fights change boss attacks patterns, tweak arenas, and add significant challenges that weren't there previously. For example, Vow of Rivals adds Charbydis to Hades 2 's Scylla boss fight.

The Vow of Rivals version of Hades 2 's final surface boss fight against Typhon, the Father of All Monsters, sees Chronos, the Titan of Time, joining the fun. This essentially combines the two hardest Hades 2 boss fights into one absurdly intense battle, which is made even tougher by Chronos being invincible to any of the player's attacks.

If players can somehow make it to the end of the new Typhon fight, they're rewarded with Chronos pulling out one of his cheap tricks again. As he summons Typhon back to the arena, he uses his time powers to de-age Hades 2 protagonist Melinoe, turning her into a weaponless child who can only avoid oncoming attacks.

It's here where Hades 2 features a hidden reference to Mortal Kombat . According to a recent Reddit post by Hades 2 dataminer nh3maser, this phase of Typhon and Chronos' boss fight is referred to as "Babality" in the game's files. This seems to be an overt reference to the finisher move of the same name which debuted in 1993's Mortal Kombat 2 , and sees players turning their opponent into an infant.

Supergiant Should Take Its Mortal Kombat Tribute to the Next Level

While it's great to hear that Supergiant had Mortal Kombat in mind while developing this phase of Hades 2 's Typhon and Chronos boss fight, it's a shame that many fans will never know it's technically in the game. It might be nice to see a more direct Mortal Kombat Easter egg in Hades 2 's 1.0 version, available for all players to see. This shouldn't be a major, immersion-breaking reference, but just a little nod to the fighting game franchise – like a throwaway voiceline – could be fun.
